channel.title: Comments on: Always Double Check Your Work
channel.description: A Technical Community for IT Professionals

item.title: By: Tahir Khalid
item.dc:creator: Tahir Khalid
item.content:encoded:
Oh god I have been going through this hell myself lately.

Been coding blind in JavaScript (and going blind in the process literally).

No debugger, no ide (apart from the wonderful Notepad++), no safety nets – I had to code the damn thing, add code to write stuff out and break it just so I could workout WTF it was doing.

Spent two days looking for a problem and it turned out my RegEx wasn’t quite right…….*cry*my*eyes*out

As a result I now need an eyesight test ðŸ˜®

item.title: By: chaospandion
item.dc:creator: chaospandion
item.content:encoded:
The expression trees can be tricky to read. Check out the equivalent C#.

(c >= 'a' && c <= 'z') || <br /> (c >= 'A' && c <= 'Z') || <br /> (c >= '0' && c <= '9') || <br /> c == '_'

item.title: By: Erik
item.dc:creator: Erik
item.content:encoded:
Correct me if I’m mistaken, but doesn’t AndAlso perform short-circuit Boolean logic? In which case will it sometimes improperly skip the second expression LessThanOrEqual for the 3 different ranges?

Is it also true that OrElse can only take two parameters?

item.title: By: chaospandion
item.dc:creator: chaospandion
item.description: Nice work, I am surprised that it took so long for someone to comment.
item.content:encoded: Nice work, I am surprised that it took so long for someone to comment.
